nodes.text: Clan Saxon, also known as the Saxon clan, was a Mandalorian clan of House Vizsla. Led by Gar Saxon, they controlled the planet Mandalore with the support of the Galactic Empire. When Gar Saxon died—killed by Ursa Wren—a civil war broke out between Clan Saxon and Clan Wren.
In addition to their rivals in Clan Wren, Clan Saxon also earned themselves the ire of House Kryze after betraying and deposing them in favor of the Empire.

A number of Mandalorians, particularly Fenn Rau of the Mandalorian Protectors and Sabine Wren, regarded the Saxon clan as traitors to Mandalore, having sold out their planet to an outside rule and betrayed Bo-Katan Kryze who many saw as the rightful ruler of Mandalore. After Gar's death on Krownest, his brother Tiber Saxon took up his position of Governor and headed their conflict with Clan Wren and the Nite Owls.

Tiber, who had completely eschewed any vestiges of loyalty towards his heritage, deployed a superweapon know as "the Duchess" against Clan Wren when they plotted with the Rebels to reclaim Mandalore, which worked by targeting and superheating the beskar alloy in Mandalorian armor, incinerating the wearer. The weapon was regarded as an abomination, for beskar armor was an inalienable part of Mandalorian culture. In response, Sabine, who had been unwittingly tricked into designing the weapon during her Academy days, led a joint force of Mandalorians and rebels to infiltrate Saxon's Star Destroyer at Sundari and destroy the "Duchess" before it could be used again. This, however, was also a trap orchestrated by Tiber, who wanted to capture Sabine and force her to perfect the weapon's range and capabilities. He confronted her on the ship, torturing her, Bo-Katan, and even his loyal subordinate Captain Hark with it in order to get her to comply. Sabine, however, used the opportunity to recalibrate it so that it targeted the Imperial's plastoid armor instead of beskar. Hark took the opportunity to escape before Wren breached the Duchess' power core. This caused the weapon to overload and blow up, taking the Star Destroyer and all hands aboard, including Tiber, with it.
